name: Zup!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, 7, Vista, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: Intel Celeron 1800 MHz Memory: 256 MB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 15 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP, 7, Vista, 8, 8.1, 10 Processor: Intel Core i3 Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Intel HD Graphics DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 20 MB available space

reviews.review_text: This is every Achievement Hunters' dream come true! (Along with with other gamers who are interested in puzzle games like this one)

It's currently 84 cents.   For that 84 cents, you'll get a very minimalistic puzzle game. You'll also get an easily achievable 118 achievements. Those achievements give you numbers and letters, so you can decorate your profile as you like. You'll also get trading cards, which you will probably need to idle to get, as the game, while fun, its quite easy. One or two challenging puzzles, but nothing too crazy.   Its also damn fun. Highly recommended.
About Zup!

Easy Peasy Lemon Squeezy!  Pros: + Game has simple yet fun concept. + Easy 100% Achievements for the achievement hunter in us. + Letters, Numbers and Symbols to personalize your achievements showcase. + Great game to relax and kill time.  Cons: - May come across as overly simplistic if you're looking for a challenge.
115 achievements in 20 minutes. might be 15 or less if you have a little more brain than i do, which isn't very hard to achieve.

Zup! is a physics-based puzzle where the objective in each level is to get the blue block on to the green zone. The only points of interaction are clicking on the red explosive blocks   (and grey squares in the DLC)   so not much time is needed to figure out the solution.  The game is amusing for its large number of achievements (118) that are unlocked for trivial actions; for example, starting a level grants an achievement, while clearing it gives another. This can be an incentive for achievement hunters looking to boost their achievement count and game completion rate, and the designs (letters, numbers and basic punctuation) are useful for decorating profiles while keeping a homogenoeus theme.  Gameplay, however, is minimal; some coloured blocks are introduced in the later levels with new mechanics, but they do not affect the level much, and the objective remains the same. The game can also be completed in under 30 minutes which may be a deterrent for those looking to maximise their gaming dollars, but at least the low price means it is accessible to almost anyone.  Ultimately, (a big) part of the value lies in the achievements, so if that is what you are looking for, pick this game up, set aside a few minutes and enjoy some demolitions along the way.
when you reach y level you'll need cs skill
I literally got 10 achievements before I even played the first level.

$1 for over 100 achievements. Sounds like a good deal already if achievements are worth less than one penny. Perfect for your AGC% on Steam.   Zup!  is a simply 2D physics-based puzzle game about placing your box on a green surface to open a door. It's pretty simple and should be finished in approximately 15-20 minutes...which does admitably harm the cost of the game, but with card drops that you can sell, you can make back about 20 cents on the title.y  I found this game to be pretty fun and is still entertaining after completion though the replayability is relatively low. As you can imagine, I would (and did) purchase this game on sale (which this game seems to do at a 10% discount). Personally, the value of this game seems to be between 30-75 cents given what you're getting.  8/10 A fun, short experience that rains achievements down on you gloriously for your success.
Honestly, If you love achievements, and an easy game to get them on, This is the game for you! Only played for 40-ish minutes, and got all of them. 10/10 would buy again.

Simple and fun puzzle game.  I guess for the price I can recommend it!   I enjoyed: +Easy to get 100% (20/30min)  +Cheap +Enjoyable +Looks good +the full game is ~20mb  Didnt enjoyed: -Only 3 or 4 levels are a bit harder -Only 20/30 min of content
This game brings over 100 achievements which you can obtain in 15 mins playing, I cant even fail at level.
Achievement game only! xD

It a very nice game and shure worth 0,99€, it has 118 achievements and is realy recomended for achievement hunters. Also the game has much levels and is not hard, would realy recomend it to buy!  I would give it a 9/10
Bought for achievements , stayed for the game , its actually quite nice i hope they add like 200 more levels as dlc or something
This game made me able to write Hentai on my profile. Thanks developer.
等等！我的卡片还开始没出呢！    这个游戏害我以为我的好友里好多人用SAM :-)    成就党专用游戏  Wait! My steam cards!    This game made me doubt why so many my friends use the SAM :-)    A game for achivements obsessives
-dropped a case in csgo -bought this game -got all achievements in 25min   10/10
The reason why i play this game is the achivment so i can get a cool profile with it.This game i think it does not make sense.
it was good i guess
Fun,cheap,short lenght physics based puzzle game 10/10

Do you love getting achievements? Do you want 118 achievements in 1 hour? Do you like explosions?  If you answered yes to these question then this game is for YOU! Cool fun little game, and although its over in 1 hour, achievements and all, the amount you get is so very satisfying, plus there's a free DLC that adds a lot more levels! SO GET IT!
Very very relaxing to play. It's worth for the price.

SHORT GAME BUT ODDLY SATISFYING WHEN COMPLETING ALL ACHIEVEMENTS IN JUST AN HOUR! THE GAME IS THE COMBINATION OF LYNE, MINESWEEPER AND ANGRY BIRDS THAT USE TO EXERCISE OUR MINDS TOWARDS DISCOVERY AND WISDOM.
very fun game , worth the price . hope to have more levels added !  i played finish the game , steam didnot give me my trading card

Do you like LOOTSPLOSIONS? Now basically kinda imagine the same thing with achievements. If that's worth the asked price to you, go nuts. If not, what's left is a very simple and short puzzle game. When I entered the first level I already had 16 achievements from clicking on random things. That made me lol so hard that I decided to give a thumbs up. This is a one time thing, whatever the next cheap game is that does this is not going to get that goodwill bonus from me.  There's a review complaining about the lack of instructions: Click on red square to make it go boom. Make things go boom in a way so that the blue square lands on the green platform. Once that happens yell VICTORY! (optional) and click on the now open door in the right bottom corner to go to the next level. Press r to reset, press escape to go back to the title screen.
Addicting but too short. 118 achievements in 20 minutes? Come on.
This game is awesome! I beat the game (100% completion and achievements) in around 39 minutes. It is short, it is sweet, and it is fun. Thank you for a great, little puzzle game!
Very simple game that provides 30 mins of enjoyment. Nothing revolutionary but it doesn't claim to be. Would recommend.
Short, funny and easy game to get 100% of the achievements!
Was a fun study break, has a cute achievement style and only took me 15 minutes to 100% the game. For $0.87, hard to go wrong!
Fun little game. Everythign works great. Easy and intuitive user interface. Worth playing.   Less than an hour's worth of content, but I did only pay $0.79 for it, so still a good value.
Short, funny and easy game to get 100% of the achievements!
I bought this game for more or less free acheivments not for the gameplay.....
I'd rate this game an 8/10, as it's lacking a '.' achievement. Otherwise, exactly what I wanted.

Zup! is a fun, casual puzzle game. Nothing special here, nor a lot of skill needed to master the game at 100%. At the sale price, it's a nice game; however, there's really no depth here for anyone looking for a true challenge. Achievements are the main priority in this game, and the developers know it, giving you 2, sometimes 3 or 4 achievements per level completion. I was able to snag 100% in only 10 minutes, but if you're looking for a game to boost achievement count without being too dull, this is the one.
A short, simple, slightly cheeky physics game.  Click the red blocks, blast the blue block in the right direction.  It's a dollar. I think it's worth a dollar.
'Press-random-♥♥♥♥-and-get-tons-of-achievements' Simulator 2016

Bought this game for 84 cents and it was totally worth it. The game is actually kind of fun. The puzzle vary between requiring cleverness, trial and error, reflexes, and some of them are just simple but satisfying. Also it showers you with achievements and makes you feel like a real lady. In 20 minutes of playtime I managed to legitimately unlock all 118 achievements. Also it's the now the final entry in my steam library, alphabetically. Just overall I personally found this to absolutely be worth buying.
Pretty nice game for 0,99€.   Also provides some nice possibilities for your achievement showcase.
The Only real reason I had bought this game was so I could use it's achievments to spell my name on my steam profile but I have to admit It was a fun game.

This is a great puzzle game that is definitely worth the money. It remind me of those flash games I used to play in computer class, and has some fun and interesting levels. The game really forces you to experiment which I definitely enjoy! I suggest this game to anyone looking for a casual game, and can honestly say it's one of the best puzzle games I've played on steam!
Pros:   - Easy - Short - Cheap - 118 Achivements - Trading Cards    Cons:   - Not enough achivements :^)
Played this game for 18 minutes, got all 118 achievements.  66 super easy levels. You click, you get an achievement. Simple as that.  Well worth the £0.79, simple, easy and fun game.
This game is good for time consuming when you want to eat your time . LOL!
easy game easy Achievements
easy game easy Achievements
Buy the game Install the game Play for 30 mins All achievements unlocked Uninstall the game
Zup is worth the small price tag, simple-smooth-addicting. But short game.   7/10

Fun achievements to customize your profile, fun game at the same time. When you want to place some cool letters with a word or your name on your profile the achievements that this game provides are so cool, I bought it for this reason but I also played it so you can get achievements, cards and kill your time with this game. I suggest you to buy Zup 2 too because it has more achievements, Greek and Japaneese letters too!
Zup is worth the small price tag, simple-smooth-addicting. But short game.   7/10
Completed all the achievement in 22 minutes! 118/10 would play again
gg ez completed 100% in 20 minutes bought for the achievements im now idling for cards
Easiest game ever! But fun one for little price. And you'll get all the acheivements in 15 minutes tops!

I've finished the game and by my game time u can tell its a really big game. But besides that its a cool game and it actually gets more interesting as u progress. For the money it is a great buy if u want to get something to entertain with. Sorry for bad english I think.

Easy achievement spammer that includes trading cards. Not really a game. If you plan on buying one, just buy the bundle. Don't buy the bundle or the individual games without a sale, it's really not worth more than $0.80 for one or $1.40 for both.
I got this to get some easy achievements and actually enjoyed the game . I played it again after all achievements were unlocked just for fun.

Zup! is a puzzle game in which you have to guide a blue cube onto a green platform.  The game is interesting, although if a little on the short end as you can easily complete it in under half an hour. The concept of the game, atleast for me, was not known early on. There is no forced tutorial, and instead I found the instructions in the menu after already completing several levels.   Overall though, the game was a fun experience, with some puzzles proving to be a bit challenging.

Well, it is just a profile builder. Player 30mins of this pathetic miniclip rip off and got all 118 achievements. I did not recieve 1 stem trading card. Like WTF. Not a single steam trading card and I finished the game. Basically, I have to AFK on the game now jus tto get the steam trade cards. Too much wasted time for my liking.
well its a fun little game, finished it in 17 min but well for that price i guess its reasonable.
♥♥♥♥♥♥ game with a lot of easy achievements. No.

The devs of this game are seriously geniuses, this game is very good for killing time, i had fun, graphics are nice, sounds is perfect too. Big+ for cards and easy achievements. I have never seen perfect game like this. Took me 30 minutes to actually done all the achievs :) Support the devs, the price is really funny, actually i would pay little bit more for this game in my opinion for such a game   11/10.  I recommend buying this game :)
It is just an easy way to get achievements. The game is hardly a challenge :\ I feel dirty
Minimal physical puzzle with explosions  ▪ 40+ Levels  ▪ 110+ Achievements Trading Cards
Eh. This game is kinda boring. All you do is blow pixels up and then let the blue one stay by itself. I forgot to turn this off now i have 7 hours when i could have got a refund.

The game is pretty weak. It comes down to clicking on a random red square and seeing what happens. If its the wrong one, no big deal, try another one.  Strangely all the positive reviews focus on how many achievements there are, and how easy they are to unlock. Do people honestly purchase games just for achievements? If so then I guess this game is for you.  The good news is the game is very cheap so its not that big of a deal, but bottom line it was not fun so thumbs down.
Very short and easy. Most of the puzzles involve the same strategy and it's down to either random chance you will get the timing or it just makes you do another click a few times.

Fantastic little game - simple, enjoyable and a sense of achievement when completing levels. Great price for a short game with a heap of achievements, trading cards and even free DLC. Well recommended and keeping a close eye on the upcoming sequel.
